questions.question: Can a Bayesian Network have cycles?

explanations.a: Based on how we construct, the graph would be directed acyclic, [Please refer: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, chapter: 14]
explanations.b: Based on how we construct, the graph would be directed acyclic, [Please refer: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, chapter: 14]
explanations.c: Based on how we construct, the graph would be directed acyclic, [Please refer: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, chapter: 14]
explanations.d: Based on how we construct, the graph would be directed acyclic, [Please refer: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, chapter: 14]

questions.question: Which of the follwing are true?

answers.a: Bayesian Network can represent any full joint probability distribution
answers.b: The graph constructed is most optimal for all valid Bayesian Network
answers.c: The graph constructed is not always optimal for all valid Bayesian Network

explanations.a: Bayesian Network can represent any full joint probability distribution
explanations.b: The graph constructed is not always optimal for all valid Bayesian Network
explanations.c: The graph constructed is not always optimal for all valid Bayesian Network
explanations.d: The graph constructed is not always optimal for all valid Bayesian Network and Bayesian Network can represent any full joint probability distribution

questions.question: If x1 is the only parent of y in Bayesian network, what can you say about P(y/x1, x2, x3)
Can you express conditional probability interms of total probability terms
Can you calculate constant in P(X/y) = const * P(X, y)?
